body.name: TRENDnet AC1200 Dual Band WiFi Router, TEW-831DR, Gigabit WAN Port, 4 x 5dBi Antennas, Wireless AC 867Mbps, Wireless N 300Mbps, Business/Home Wireless AC Router for High Speed Internet,MU-MIMO Support
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery February 25 - 28 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: HIGH SPEED WIRELESS ROUTER: AC1200: 867Mbps Wireless AC + 300Mbps Wireless N
DEVICE INTERFACE: 1 x Gigabit WAN port, 3 x 10/100Mbps Ethernet LAN Ports, 4 x 5 dBi Dual Band Antennas
PRE-ENCRYPTED: For your convenience, the wireless networks are pre-encrypted with unique passwords.
INCREASED WIRELESS COVERAGE: 4 x 5dBi external antennas provide extended wireless coverage.
INTERNET BANDWIDTH CONTROLS: Control access to the internet, and manage bandwidth for devices connected to the wireless ac 1200 router.
ONE TOUCH CONNECTION: Connect to the wireless ac home and business router using the Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) button
IPv6 NETWORK SUPPORT: LAN/WAN IPv6 Support

MULTI-USER (MU-MIMO) SUPPORT: MU-MIMO (multi-user, multiple input, multiple output) was created to support environments where multiple users are trying to access a wireless network at the same time. MU-MIMO helps by allowing for multiple users to access router functions without congestion.
body.description: TRENDnet's AC1200 Dual Band WiFi Router, model TEW-831DR, is a high-speed wireless ac router designed to handle multiple HD streams in a busy connected home. This dual band wireless ac router creates two concurrent wireless networks—a high performance 867Mbps wireless AC network, and a 300Mbps wireless N network for wireless device connections. For added convenience, the wireless networks are pre-encrypted out of the box.Pre-EncryptedFor your convenience, the wireless networks are pre-encrypted with unique passwords.5dBi External Antennas4 x 5dBi external antennas provide extended wireless coverage.Internet Bandwidth ControlsControl access to the internet and manage bandwidth for devices connected to the wireless ac router.Package Contents• TEW-831DR• Quick Installation Guide• Network cable (1.5m / 5 ft.)• Power adapter (12V DC, 1A)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Dual-WAN meant for SMB but not as configurable as it should be
reviews.reviewText: Updated 5th January 2022: Initially the router was advertised with RouterLimits basic offering included. It worked for a couple of years, then RouerLimits basic offering went away, and I was left with either paying for RouterLimits or not having it. I see that from amazon.com features list, they've now removed this feature (free basic offering), however for a while it was there, while the feature did not work without additional payment. Now it's advertised as a feature that you can sign up and pay for and works with the router. IMO it is a similar feature to the TrendMicro offering that's included with many Asus routers, and some TP-Link routers. Other than this, so far, in home setting this router has been amazingly reliable.---------------------------Like:1. Simple dual WAN load balancing with common sense options built-in2. Plenty of gigabit Ethernet ports3. Only rack-mountable router with built-in WiFi 5 that I have found.4. Range great for wifi 2.4 and 5-1 (1733 Mbps)5. Price is affordable for home use in comparison to other products and comes out of the box with way more functionalities ( e.g. VLAN tagging, WiFi SSID to VLAN mapping, tri-band WiFi, easy Dual-WAN load balancing, subscription option for router limits IPS)6. USB 3 port for add-on storage7. Open source OS with potential for after market firmwareDislike:1. Range useless for wifi 5-2 (866 Mbps), unusable even at the end of a long open room (no interference 50 away RSSI shows -65), no signal in a different room (range is less than Bluetooth 4 even in open area)2. Router Limits basic was offered as built-in free feature for life when I purchased the router. Apparently the life ended, and this feature is no longer there. Paid subscription option for Router Limits is still available. While the basic option was available, I've used it and found it quite reliable/usable. I have not tried the paid subscription version.3. No option to use DFS4. No option for LAG (8x 1 Gbps ethernet ports)5. Software hard to use, shows lots of errors in the log but no way to resolve those6. Updates are rare and hard to come by (seen 2-3 updates so far that didn't add anything new, fixed security vulnerabilities albeit quite late)7. USB port cannot be used for LTE backup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Set up is easy and WAN failover is automatic.
reviews.reviewText: I set this up via an Ethernet cable plugged into one of its 8 LAN ports. Very easy to configure. Located the administrative settings and told it to update its firmware from its mother ship. Worked fine. I have two ISPs; the failover is the entire reason I moved onto this router.Bonus is that when you change network settings and the device restarts, it reconnects to WAN and its WLAN clients quickly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast router - good product
reviews.reviewText: Good product was easy to setup

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great for Multi WLAN - Update the Firmware!
reviews.reviewText: Great router for MultiWLAN or Multihoming but you need to update the firmware and you need to do it via a wired connection. The router kept disconnecting for me, just randomly softbricking and needing a reset until i updated the firmware now it's fine.It's going to need some configuring and it's not a "gaming" router so the options aren't apparent. It'll start by being configured with connection 1 as default and connection 2 and fallback. I leaned towards having both connections up and "load balanced" giving me the combined download/upload of both. I have spectrum and Starry. Spectrum 400dl 20ul / Starry 250dl 250ul and this router manages to get my overall connection to 750dl 250ul which is the reason I wanted it in the first place.There's a pretty extensive vpn feature built in but the media share feature is kinda broken.Solid kit but needs a cs degree to set up

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Router is okay, but has some flaws
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this router to use in my home network hoping the wifi signal would be stronger than the consumer routers. I was sorely disappointed. The wifi barely reaches my second room. I live in a ranch-style apartment that is only 1054 sq ft. It has the same issue with wifi that my old router had. The second bedroom barely receives a 2.4 signal and the 5.0 is abysmal. In addition, there is no web filtering ability other than signing up for Router Limites (either 10/month or 99/yr). I called Trendnets tech support to verify this and that is what they said. I'm keeping the router because I think it's possible due to the construction of the walls that the signal doesn't reach well. I tried two other routers and same issue. But now I have to find a firewall appliance to do some web filtering.In addition, I cannot use the USB port to use my phone as a backup connection. I tried to use a USB C to Ethernet but currently Android only allows data in through USB Ethernet, not data out. Android 11 seems to bring this functionality to the OS, so hopefully, I will be able to connect to the WAN 2 port to set up failover.Overall the router is okay, has some good options, and feels well built, but there are some definite improvements that need to be made.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Great home router, but SMB? Nah.
reviews.reviewText: I need a small business router... and the TEW-829DRU (aka AC3000) router is marketed as exactly that: "SMB." I'm sure the wi-fi features are impressive, but that's not what makes an SMB router "exactly that." It's the filters, the VPN, the firewall that set a good business router apart from just another souped-up high-bandwidth wi-fi transmitting (i.e., WAP) box that is called, rather broadly, a "router." Sadly, the aforementioned business-like features are weird to set up, compared to industry peer equipments, and in the case of IPSec VPN Site-to-Site, DON'T WORK. The User's Manual gives sparse example of set up but it's between two identical routers. In this industry, VPN edgerouters of every make and model are supposed to play together nicely. Ironically, an older Trendnet router (TWG-431BR) did so easily... but had OTHER fatal quirks. And there is no VLAN Access Control List, per se; you have to use IP filtering as a work around... and then debug what should have simply worked.
Es una buena marca y de buena calidad. NO het enido problemas y es facil de operar

reviews.reviewTitle: Relación costo y beneficio es buenísima
reviews.reviewText: Respaldo de Internet, muy sensillo y fácil de instalar, funcional e cumple su propoaito
